title: Suffixes

properties.name: description
properties.value: Suffixes refer to additional information appended to the end of an item's name contained within parentheses, item in this case can refer to any of the following: non-player characters, monsters, items, or objects. Suffixes are generally used to denote specific attributes or to help distinguish an item from another similar item.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Suffixes

Suffixes refer to additional information appended to the end of an item's name contained within parentheses, item in this case can refer to any of the following: non-player characters, monsters, items, or objects. Suffixes are generally used to denote specific attributes or to help distinguish an item from another similar item.

Common suffixes[edit | edit source]

Suffix Meaning
Item-based
(unf) Unfinished potions or bolts (aka unfeathered).
(u) Generally denotes an unstrung item, can also refer to upgraded, uncharged, or unfinished.
(empty) Denotes an item as exhausted, used up entirely, or never filed. Some items function similarly to (uncharged) items.
(full) Denotes an item as full to capacity.
(w) Denotes a tree seedling has been watered.
(m) Ales that have been become mature during the brewing process.
(kg) Differentiates the weight of an object in kilograms.
(a) Activated items.
(nz) Nightmare Zone variants of items.
(lg) Grand Exchange item sets containing platelegs.
(sk) Grand Exchange item sets containing plateskirts.
(wound) Denotes a clockwork toy that has been wound, ready to release.
(tattered) Differentiates tattered from regular Kq heads as a guarenteed drop.
(+) Denotes greater raid potion potency.
(-) Denotes weaker raid potion potency.
Equipment-based
(e) Enchanted or enhanced equipment.
(i) Imbued equipment.
(p), (p+), (p++) Poisonous, indicating the type of weapon poison ((+), (++)) applied.
(kp) Poisonous, indicating karambwan paste was applied.
(broken) Unusable after death within the Wilderness below level 20.
(l) Locked items enchanted with trouver parchments, prevents items from becoming (broken) upon death beyond level 20 within the Wilderness.
(uncharged) Degradable items with no charges remaining, unusable or usable without item effects.
(inactive) Denotes an item as being inactive, functionally similar to (uncharged).
(basic), (attuned), (perfected) Denotes tier of equipment created in the Gauntlet.
(r) Denotes the recoil effect, or red ornamentation of an item.
(o) Offensive blackjacks.
(d) Defensive blackjacks.
(b) Blessed items able to cast bloom.
(lit) Lit fire arrows used in the Underground Pass quest.
Ornamental based
(t) Trimmed equipment.
(g) Gilded or Gold-trimmed equipment.
(or) Denotes certain ornamental equipment.
(h1) Denotes an item that is part of set 1 of heraldic armour.
(h2) Denotes an item that is part of set 2 of heraldic armour.
(h3) Denotes an item that is part of set 3 of heraldic armour.
(h4) Denotes an item that is part of set 4 of heraldic armour.
(h5) Denotes an item that is part of set 5 of heraldic armour.
(dark) Denotes an item that is part of the dark mystic robes set.
(light) Denotes an item that is part of the light mystic robes set.
(dusk) Denotes an item that is part of the dusk mystic robes set.
Difficulty based
(beginner) Differentiates items as part of beginner Treasure Trails.
(easy) Denotes an item as easy.
(medium) Denotes an item as medium.
(hard) Denotes an item as hard.
(elite) Denotes an item as elite.
(master) Differentiates items as part of master Treasure Trails.
Miscellaneous
(numerical) Denotes quantity, such as remaining charges or contents of a container, or tier of item.
(blue) Denotes blue colour.
(green) Denotes green colour.
(red) Denotes red colour.
(tier) Denotes an item is divided into tiers, always accompanied by a numerical value.
(dry) Differentiates an items dry state.

Single-use suffixes[edit | edit source]

  • (enraged), used by Tekton in his enraged stance.
  • (eternal), used to differentiate a slayer ring (eternal) made with an eternal gem.
  • (excerpt), used to denote The truth behind the myth (excerpt) as being a partial text.
  • (guthix), (saradomin), and (zamorak), used to differentiate between the rune scimitar ornament kits.
  • (Healthy), used by kharidian cactus to indicate that it can fill a waterskin.
  • (herb) and (water), used by dream vials to differentiate between states.
  • (inert), used to denote an uncharged Xeric's talisman.
  • (Left claw) and (Right claw), used by the hands of the Great Olm boss.
  • (level), used during The Forsaken Tower quest to differentiate between energy disk sizes.
  • (maxhit), used by active undead combat dummies.
  • (Novice), (Intermediate), and (Veteran), used by Squire (Novice), Squire (Intermediate), and Squire (Veteran) respectively to indiciate which Pest Control lander they operate.
  • (orange), used by the mystical barrier inside the Chambers of Xeric.
  • (part), used by torn clue scrolls as part of master Treasure Trails.
  • (Razmire) and (Ulsquire), used by Razmire Keelgan and Ulsquire Shauncy in afflicted states.
  • (ring) and (seeds), used by nest boxes to differentiate between contents.
  • (second form), (third form), and (fourth form), used by the witch's experiment's different stages.
  • (sick), (very sick), (ghastly!), and (well), used by Marv, Hank, Wilf, Sarah, and Rachel during the campsite Temple Trekking event.
  • (unpowered), used by incomplete bottled dragonbreath.
  • (untradeable), used by old school bonds that have been traded.
  • (wet), used during the 2017 Christmas event to differentiate wet Santa suit from other states.
  • (white), used by the energy focus in the jewelled crab room in the Chambers of Xeric.

Grand Exchange pricing experts[edit | edit source]

Each of the Grand Exchange pricing experts, with the exception of Brugsen Bursen, has their own unique suffix.

  • (herbs), used by Bob Barter (herbs).
  • (logs), used by Relobo Blinyo (logs).
  • (ores and bars), used by Farid Morrisane (ores and bars).
  • (runes), used by Murky Matt (runes).
  • (weapons and armour), used by Hofuthand (weapons and armour).

rawContent:
{{External|rs}}
'''Suffixes''' refer to additional information appended to the end of an ''item''<nowiki/>'s name contained within parentheses, ''item'' in this case can refer to any of the following: [[non-player character]]s, [[monsters]], [[items]], or [[scenery|objects]]. Suffixes are generally used to denote specific attributes or to help distinguish an ''item'' from another similar ''item''.

==Common suffixes==
{| class="wikitable align-center-1"
!Suffix
!Meaning
|-
!colspan="2"|Item-based
|-
|'''[[(unf)]]'''
|[[Unfinished potion|''Unfinished'' potions]] or [[Unfinished bolts|bolts]] (aka ''unfeathered'').
|-
|'''[[(u)]]'''
|Generally denotes an ''unstrung'' item, can also refer to ''upgraded'', ''uncharged'', or ''unfinished''.
|-
|'''[[(empty)]]'''
|Denotes an ''item'' as exhausted, used up entirely, or never filed. Some items function similarly to (uncharged) items.
|-
|'''[[(full)]]'''
|Denotes an ''item'' as full to capacity.
|-
|'''[[(w)]]'''
|Denotes a [[tree seedling]] has been ''watered''.
|-
|'''[[(m)]]'''
|[[Ale]]s that have been become [[mature ale|''mature'']] during the [[brewing]] process.
|-
|'''[[(kg)]]'''
|Differentiates the weight of an object in ''kilograms''.
|-
|'''[[(a)]]'''
|''Activated'' items.
|-
|'''[[(nz)]]'''
|''[[Nightmare Zone]]'' variants of items.
|-
|'''[[(lg)]]'''
|[[Grand Exchange]] [[item set]]s containing ''[[platelegs]]''.
|-
|'''[[(sk)]]'''
|Grand Exchange item sets containing ''[[plateskirt]]s''.
|-
|'''[[(wound)]]'''
|Denotes a [[clockwork]] toy that has been ''wound'', ready to release.
|-
|'''[[(tattered)]]'''
|Differentiates [[kq head (tattered)|''tattered'']] from regular [[Kq head]]s as a guarenteed drop.
|-
|'''[[(+)]]'''
|Denotes greater [[Chambers of Xeric/Potions|raid potion]] potency.
|-
|'''[[(-)]]'''
|Denotes weaker raid potion potency.
|-
!colspan="2"|Equipment-based
|-
|'''[[(e)]]'''
|''Enchanted'' or ''enhanced'' equipment.
|-
|'''[[(i)]]'''
|[[Imbuing|''Imbued'']] equipment.
|-
|'''[[(p)]]''', '''[[(p+)]]''', '''[[(p++)]]'''
|''[[Poison]]ous'', indicating the type of ''[[weapon poison]] <sup>([[weapon poison(+)|(+)]], [[weapon poison(++)|(++)]])</sup>'' applied.
|-
|'''[[(kp)]]'''
|Poisonous, indicating ''[[karambwan paste]]'' was applied.
|-
|'''[[(broken)]]'''
|Unusable after [[death]] within the [[Wilderness]] below level 20.
|-
|'''[[(l)]]'''
|''Locked'' items enchanted with [[trouver parchment]]s, prevents items from becoming [[(broken)]] upon death beyond level 20 within the [[Wilderness]].
|-
|'''[[(uncharged)]]'''
|[[Degradation|Degradable]] items with ''no charges'' remaining, unusable or usable without item effects.
|-
|'''[[(inactive)]]'''
|Denotes an ''item'' as being ''inactive'', functionally similar to (uncharged).
|-
|'''[[(basic)]]''', '''[[(attuned)]]''', '''[[(perfected)]]'''
|Denotes tier of equipment created in [[the Gauntlet]].
|-
|'''[[(r)]]'''
|Denotes the ''recoil'' effect, or ''red'' ornamentation of an item.
|-
|'''[[(o)]]'''
|''Offensive'' [[blackjack]]s.
|-
|'''[[(d)]]'''
|''Defensive'' blackjacks.
|-
|'''[[(b)]]'''
|''Blessed'' items able to cast [[bloom]].
|-
|'''[[(lit)]]'''
|''Lit'' [[fire arrows]] used in the [[Underground Pass]] quest.
|-
!colspan="2"|[[Ornamental armour|Ornamental]] based
|-
|'''[[(t)]]'''
|''Trimmed'' equipment.
|-
|'''[[(g)]]'''
|''Gilded'' or ''Gold-trimmed'' equipment.
|-
|'''[[(or)]]'''
|Denotes certain ''ornamental'' equipment.
|-
|'''[[(h1)]]'''
|Denotes an item that is part of set 1 of [[heraldic armour]].
|-
|'''[[(h2)]]'''
|Denotes an item that is part of set 2 of heraldic armour.
|-
|'''[[(h3)]]'''
|Denotes an item that is part of set 3 of heraldic armour.
|-
|'''[[(h4)]]'''
|Denotes an item that is part of set 4 of heraldic armour.
|-
|'''[[(h5)]]'''
|Denotes an item that is part of set 5 of heraldic armour.
|-
|'''[[(dark)]]'''
|Denotes an item that is part of the dark [[mystic robes]] set.
|-
|'''[[(light)]]'''
|Denotes an item that is part of the light [[mystic robes]] set.
|-
|'''[[(dusk)]]'''
|Denotes an item that is part of the dusk [[mystic robes]] set.
|-
!colspan="2"|Difficulty based
|-
|'''[[(beginner)]]'''
|Differentiates ''items'' as part of beginner [[Treasure Trails]].
|-
|'''[[(easy)]]'''
|Denotes an ''item'' as ''easy''.
|-
|'''[[(medium)]]'''
|Denotes an ''item'' as ''medium''.
|-
|'''[[(hard)]]'''
|Denotes an ''item'' as ''hard''.
|-
|'''[[(elite)]]'''
|Denotes an ''item'' as ''elite''.
|-
|'''[[(master)]]'''
|Differentiates ''items'' as part of master [[Treasure Trails]].
|-
!colspan="2"|Miscellaneous
|-
|'''[[(numerical)]]'''
|Denotes quantity, such as remaining charges or contents of a container, or tier of item.
|-
|'''[[(blue)]]'''
|Denotes ''blue'' colour.
|-
|'''[[(green)]]'''
|Denotes ''green'' colour.
|-
|'''[[(red)]]'''
|Denotes ''red'' colour.
|-
|'''[[(tier)]]'''
|Denotes an ''item'' is divided into ''tiers'', always accompanied by a numerical value.
|-
|'''[[(dry)]]'''
|Differentiates an ''items'' dry state.
|}

==Single-use suffixes==
*''(enraged)'', used by [[Tekton]] in his enraged stance.
*''(eternal)'', used to differentiate a [[slayer ring (eternal)]] made with an [[eternal gem]].
*''(excerpt)'', used to denote [[The truth behind the myth (excerpt)]] as being a partial text.
*''(guthix)'', ''(saradomin)'', and ''(zamorak)'', used to differentiate between the [[rune scimitar]] [[ornament kit]]s.
*''(Healthy)'', used by [[kharidian cactus]] to indicate that it can fill a [[waterskin]].
*''(herb)'' and ''(water)'', used by [[dream vial]]s to differentiate between states.
*''(inert)'', used to denote an uncharged [[Xeric's talisman]].
*''(Left claw)'' and ''(Right claw)'', used by the hands of the [[Great Olm]] [[boss]].
*''(level)'', used during [[The Forsaken Tower]] [[quest]] to differentiate between [[energy disk]] sizes.
*''(maxhit)'', used by active [[undead combat dummy|undead combat dummies]].
*''(Novice)'', ''(Intermediate)'', and ''(Veteran)'', used by [[Squire (Novice)]], [[Squire (Intermediate)]], and [[Squire (Veteran)]] respectively to indiciate which [[Pest Control]] lander they operate.
*''(orange)'', used by the [[mystical barrier]] inside the [[Chambers of Xeric]].
*''(part)'', used by [[torn clue scroll]]s as part of master [[Treasure Trails]].
*''(Razmire)'' and ''(Ulsquire)'', used by [[Razmire Keelgan]] and [[Ulsquire Shauncy]] in [[afflicted]] states.
*''(ring)'' and ''(seeds)'', used by [[nest box]]es to differentiate between contents.
*''(second form)'', ''(third form)'', and ''(fourth form)'', used by the [[witch's experiment]]'s different stages.
*''(sick)'', ''(very sick)'', ''(ghastly!)'', and ''(well)'', used by [[Marv]], [[Hank]], [[Wilf]], [[Sarah (Temple Trekking)|Sarah]], and [[Rachel]] during the campsite [[Temple Trekking]] event.
*''(unpowered)'', used by incomplete [[bottled dragonbreath]].
*''(untradeable)'', used by [[old school bond]]s that have been traded.
*''(wet)'', used during the [[2017 Christmas event]] to differentiate wet [[Santa suit]] from other states.
*''(white)'', used by the [[energy focus]] in the [[jewelled Crab|jewelled crab]] room in the [[Chambers of Xeric]].

===Grand Exchange pricing experts===
Each of the [[Grand Exchange]] pricing experts, with the exception of [[Brugsen Bursen]], has their own unique suffix.
*''(herbs)'', used by [[Bob Barter (herbs)]].
*''(logs)'', used by [[Relobo Blinyo (logs)]].
*''(ores and bars)'', used by [[Farid Morrisane (ores and bars)]].
*''(runes)'', used by [[Murky Matt (runes)]].
*''(weapons and armour)'', used by [[Hofuthand (weapons and armour)]].
